usefulItems: thermal serving bowl or other large bowl
title: Millet cashew stir-fry

ingredients.content: 2 ½ tbsp tamari, gluten free (see Tips)
1 lime (zest of half a lime, juice of whole lime)
1 - 2 fresh long red chilli, trimmed and cut into halves, deseeded if preferred
2 ½ cm piece fresh ginger, peeled
120 g carrot, cut into pieces (2 cm)
120 g cabbage, cut into pieces (3 cm)
1 red onion (approx. 120 g), cut into thin slices
227 g canned water chestnuts, cut into thin slices

preparations.content: Place tamari, maple syrup, cornflour, lime zest and juice into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and stir to combine. Place thermal serving bowl with sauce onto mixing bowl lid and weigh spinach and bean sprouts into it. Set aside.

Place millet and water into mixing bowl and cook <b>12-16 min/98°C/speed 1<b>, until water is absorbed. Transfer into the thermal serving bowl with spinach, then stir to combine and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place oil, chilli, garlic and ginger into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then cook <b>3 min/120°C/speed 1<b>, <b>without measuring cup.<b>

Add cashews, onion, capsicum and water chestnuts and stir with aid of spatula, then cook <b>3 min/120°C//speed 1<b>. Transfer into thermal serving bowl with millet mixture and stir with aid of spatula, then serve.

hintsAndTricks: Be sure to check the label of your tamari, as not all brands are gluten free.
